Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Field Representative Officer - Survey specialist – SIFSIS (Institutional Capacity Support Programme for an Integrated Food Security, Vulnerability and Market Information System) – mission in Sudan and South Sudan.
Grant from Associazione Guido Carli. Amount: 10,000 Euro.
Field Representative Officer - Survey specialist – FAO of the UN mission – South Sudan – preparatory activities of the Sudan Household and Health Survey.
Grant from Banca Popolare di Ancona: 5000 Euro

Invited seminar: University of East Anglia, 2007
Organizzazione: ESA 2007 World Meeting at LUISS in Rome Organizzatore - http://static.luiss.it/esa2007/organisers.php
Invited speaker: Alhambra Experimental Meeting 2007, Granada

Partecipazione come relatore a: 49ma RSA Societa' Italiana Economisti 2008, Perugia, Italy Anna Conte: A Test of the Rational Expectations Hypothesis using Data from a Natural Experiment,
Invited seminar: LUISS Guido Carli Rome, 2009
Invited seminar: Max Planck Institute of Economics Jena, 2009

Partecipazione come relatore a: AES 2010 - 15th Annual Conference on Econometric Modelling for Africa, Cairo, Egypt Anna Conte: The Econometric Modelling of Social Preferences
Partecipazione come relatore a: ESA conference 2012, Cologne Anna Conte: Experiences in public goods games
Invited speaker: Workshop on Risk and Ambiguity 2013, Durham
Invited seminar: University of York, 2013
Invited seminar: University of Trento, 2013
Invited speaker: 2014 ESI Workshop on Institutions, Games and Experiments, Jena, Germany
Invited speaker: Workshop on Behavioural Game Theory 2014, Jena, Germany
Partecipazione come relatore a: ESA European Meeting 2015, Heidelberg, Germany Anna Conte: Heterogeneity in risk attitudes across domains: A bivariate random preference approach

Partecipazione come relatore a: ExperiMetrix in Alicante 2015, Workshop on Econometric Techniques to Analyze Exerimental Evidence, Alicante, Spain Anna Conte: Heterogeneity in risk attitudes across domains: A bivariate random preference approach
Partecipazione come relatore al convegno RES conference 2016, Brighton, UK Anna Conte: Heterogeneity in Risk Attitudes across Domains: A Bivariate Random Preference Approach

Partecipazione come relatore a: 2016 LabSi Lab2 Workshop on Game Theory and Experimental Economics, Capua, Italy Anna Conte: More certainty or more money? Behavioural types in a stochastic bargaining experiment

Partecipazione come relatore a: FUR Conference: Foundations of Utility and Risk 2016, University of Warwick, UK Anna Conte – Heterogeneity in Risk Attitudes Across Domains: A Bivariate Random Preference Approach

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Research assistant – FAO of the UN – Headquarter in Rome, Italy
Visiting Scholar – University of East Anglia – Norwich, UK
Post-Doc (assegnista di ricerca) Dipartimento di Scienze Economiche e Statistiche – University of Rome La Sapienza – Rome, Italy.
Post-Doc Centre for Employment Research – Westminster Business School – London, UK.
Research Fellow Max Planck Institute of Economics – Strategic Interaction Group –Jena, Germany
Senior Lecturer – Department of Economics and Quantitative Methods – Westminster Business School – University of Westminster – London, UK
Visiting Scholar – Max Planck Institute of Economics (on-leave from University of Westminster)– Strategic Interaction Group – Jena, Germany.
Visiting Scholar – Max Planck Institute of Economics – Strategic Interaction Group – Jena, Germany.

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: PRIN 2005 - Progetto: "Un approccio sperimentale alle scelte intertemporali e relative conseguenze per il comportamento economico"; Scientific coordinator: John Denis Hey; Unità di ricerca: Libera Univ. Inter.le Studi Sociali “Guido Carli” LUISS-ROMA (Scientific officer: Daniela Teresa Di Cagno); Durata: 24 mesi

JOINT PROJECTS 2011 (Max Planck Institute of Economics – University of Verona), Punishment and decision-making: neuroeconomics foundations, behavioural experiments and implications for law and economics.

Research Project: Quality assurance of Econometric Analyses and Evaluation. Funding body: HMRC. Submitted as named researcher and provided advice on HMRC evaluation in 2015. Role: Co-investigator – Providing econometric support for economic evaluation. Application amount: 30,000£. Outcome: awarded.

Research Project: Early identification of young people at risk of poor educational and labour market outcomes: the role of educational institutions. Funding body: ESRC. Role: Co-investigator with Peter Urwin (PI), University of Bath and FFT Datalab. Application amount: 200,000£. Outcome: awarded.
